item.description:
Alternative Economics Working Group Meeting 
1pm-4pm, Saturday, Jan 21st 
Meg Perry Center at 644 Congress St. in Portland, Maine.

A meeting to further collaboration and communication to create a community based democratic economy.  

  • Breakout groups to brainstorm how to advocate for and support potential projects:
  • Cooperative models of community ownership- increasing local access to food, housing, transportation, energy
  • Local Currency - what would a local currency for Portland do, what would our exchanges look like? we will look at models like www.berkshares.org or www.ithacahours.org or TimeDollars which  exists here as www.hourexchangeportland.org and could be used as a tool to increase resource sharing between both individuals and organizations
  • Measuring the alternative economy and quality of life as opposed to GDP with models like a Happiness Index http://www.happyplanetindex.org/learn/download-report.html 

Topics of whole group discussion may include:

  • What would a Network look like that would support local economic sustainability initiatives? 
  • Ideas for outreach, collaboration and promotion between organizations and to the general public through media campaigns, putting on an event, or a website directory likehttp://maine.find.coop ?
  • What is the name of our "new" or "alternative" economy?

  The meeting is set to last approx. 3 hours, and afterwards everyone is invited to support the Local Sprouts Cooperative Café across the street.  Coffee and light food will be provided at the meeting.
